alert.note: Alert for Eastern San Miguel County; Quay County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 27 at 5:10PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF EAST CENTRAL SAN MIGUEL AND NORTHWESTERN QUAY COUNTIES THROUGH 545 PM MDT... At 510 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles northwest of Tucumcari, moving northwest at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of east central San Miguel and northwestern Quay Counties. This includes State Road 104 between Mile Markers 84 and 100. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Eastern San Miguel County; Quay County
